alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:59PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Elbert County through 230 PM MDT... At 158 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Kiowa, or 32 miles northeast of Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kiowa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
